author: Hamish Mackay
title: Atletico Madrid's Lucas Hernandez and ex-partner both given community service following domestic violence convictions
text:
Atletico Madrid defender Lucas Hernandez leaves court (Photo: Europa Press/Getty Images) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Atletico Madrid defender Lucas Hernandez will have to carry out 31 days of community service after being found guilty of domestic violence. 
Prosecutors had called for a seven month prison sentence after Lucas was charged with assaulting his partner, but his legal team successfully argued that any sentence should be handed out int he form of a societal contribution. 
Prosecutors also argued his ex-partner, Amelia de la Ossa Lorente, should be given a six month prison sentence for her role in the incident. Llorente was also accused of violence of damaging Lucas's car. 
Llorente was indeed found guilty but, like Lucas, escaped a custodial sentence. Instead, she too was given 31 days of community service. The France U21 defender's former girlfriend Amelia Lorente (Photo: Europa Press/Getty Images) Lucas in action against Bayern Munich (Photo: Alexander Hassenstein / Getty) 
While judge Borja Vargues ruled that both parties were equally guilty, Llorente was ordered to pay €180 (£154) in damages in addition to her community service. 
Both parties have 30 days to appeal their sentences, which also include an order not to come within 500 metres of each other. 
The Atletico star and Llorente reportedly wanted to settle the matter with the magistrate but the case was referred to a criminal court by the prosecutor. 
France Under-21 international Lucas last featured for his club 10 days ago, playing 90 minutes as Atletico beat Sporting Gijon 4-1 in La Liga. Like us on Facebook
